panels.description: Number of databases per service. Includes system databases.
panels.title: Number of databases

panels.description: Number of tables per service. Includes system tables.
panels.title: Number of tables

panels.description: Compressed. Includes system tables.
panels.title: Total data in MergeTree tables

panels.description: Uncompressed, as stored in memory.
panels.title: Data selected per second

panels.description: Uncompressed, as stored in memory.
panels.title: Data inserted per second

panels.description: Maximum CPU usage among the server pods over the specified period of time.
panels.title: Max Server CPU Usage

panels.description: Maximum server memory usage among the server pods over the specified period of time.
panels.title: Max Server Memory Usage

panels.description: Maximum number of parts per partition over the specified period of time.
panels.title: Max Parts Per Partition

panels.description: Maximum percentage of the failed SELECTs over the specified period of time.
panels.title: Max Percent of Failed SELECTs

panels.description: Maximum percentage of the failed INSERTs over the specified period of time (both synchronous and asynchronous).
panels.title: Max Percent of Failed INSERTs

panels.description: Maximum number of log message with ERROR (and higher) severity over the specified period of time.
panels.title: Max logged errors

panels.description: Number of queries to be interpreted and potentially executed. Does not include asynchronous inserts. Does not include queries that failed to parse or were rejected due to AST size limits, quota limits or limits on the number of simultaneously running queries. May include internal queries initiated by ClickHouse itself. Does not count subqueries.
panels.title: Total Queries

panels.description: Average query latency
panels.title: Query latency (average)

panels.description: Number of times when memory limit exceeded for query.
panels.title: Queries with MEMORY_LIMIT_EXCEEDED

panels.description: Number of failed queries.
panels.title: Failed Queries

panels.description: Same as Queries, but only for SELECT queries.
panels.title: SELECT Queries

panels.description: Same as Queries, but only for INSERT queries. Only accounts for synchronous inserts.
panels.title: Synchronous INSERT Queries

panels.description: Same as Failed Queries, but only for SELECT queries.
panels.title: Failed SELECT Queries

panels.description: Same as Failed Queries, but only for INSERT queries. Only accounts for Synchronous inserts.
panels.title: Failed Synchronous INSERT Queries

panels.description: Average SELECT query latency
panels.title: SELECT query latency (average)

panels.description: Average INSERT query latency. Accounts only for synchronous inserts.
panels.title: Synchronous INSERT query latency (average)

panels.description: Same as Queries, but only for INSERT queries. Only accounts for asynchronous inserts.
panels.title: Asynchronous INSERT Queries

panels.description: Same as Failed Queries, but only for INSERT queries. Only accounts for asynchronous inserts.
panels.title: Failed Asynchronous INSERT Queries

panels.description: Number of asynchronous inserts waiting to be flushed.
panels.title: Pending Asynchronous INSERT queries

panels.description: Number of data parts selected to read.
panels.title: Selected Parts

panels.description: Number of (non-adjacent) ranges in all data parts selected to read.
panels.title: Selected Ranges

panels.description: Number of index granules (marks) selected to read.
panels.title: Selected Marks

panels.description: Number of rows selected from all tables (including system tables).
panels.title: Selected Rows

panels.description: Bytes selected from all tables (uncompressed, for columns as they stored in memory, including system tables)
panels.title: Selected Bytes

panels.description: Number of rows inserted to all tables (including system tables).
panels.title: Inserted rows (all tables)

panels.description: Bytes inserted to all tables (uncompressed, for all columns as they are stored in memory, including system tables)
panels.title: Inserted bytes (all tables)

panels.description: Number of rows INSERTed to MergeTree tables.
panels.title: MergeTree inserted rows

panels.description: Number of blocks INSERTed to MergeTree tables. Each block forms a data part of level zero.
panels.title: MergeTree inserted blocks

panels.description: Uncompressed bytes (for columns as they stored in memory) INSERTed to MergeTree tables.
panels.title: MergeTree uncompressed bytes

panels.description: Bytes written to filesystem for data INSERTed to MergeTree tables.
panels.title: MergeTree compressed bytes

panels.description: Rate of rejected inserts due to "TOO_MANY_PARTS" exception.
panels.title: Rejected Inserts (TOO_MANY_PARTS)

panels.description: Rate inserts that were throttled due to high number of active data parts for partition.
panels.title: Delayed Inserts

panels.description: Average time that insert was throttled due to high number of active data parts for partition.
panels.title: Delayed Inserts Latency (average)

panels.description: Number of launched background merges.
panels.title: Merges

panels.description: Number of running mutations.
panels.title: Mutations

panels.description: Total amount of memory (bytes) allocated by background tasks (merges and mutations).
panels.title: Memory used by mutations & merges

panels.description: Average merge duration (milliseconds)
panels.title: Merge duration (average)

panels.description: Rows read for background merges. This is the number of rows before merge.
panels.title: Merged rows

panels.description: Uncompressed bytes (for columns as they stored in memory) that was read for background merges. This is the number before merge.
panels.title: Merged bytes (uncompressed)

panels.description: Disk space reserved for currently running background merges. It is slightly more than the total size of currently merging parts.
panels.title: Space reserved for merges
Local instance page cache hit rate

panels.description: Total amount of data parts in all tables of MergeTree family. Numbers larger than 10 000 will negatively affect the server startup time, and it may indicate unreasonable choice of the partition key.
panels.title: Total parts

panels.description: The part is in data_parts, but not used for SELECTs.
panels.title: Pre-active parts

panels.description: The part is being generating now, it is not in data_parts list.
panels.title: Temporary parts

panels.description: Data part that could be used only running SELECTs. Could be deleted after queries finish.
panels.title: Outdated parts

panels.description: Active data parts, used by SELECTs
panels.title: Active parts

panels.description: Parts in a "Deleting" status. Not an active data part with identity refcounter, it is  being deleted right now by a cleaner.
panels.title: Parts being deleted
